member.summary: Gets binary data. Returns registry data size that the function copied into the 'data' memory. It can be equal or less than the 'size' argument. If registry data is bigger than 'size', gets only 'size' part of it. If valueName does not exist, returns 0. If fails, returns -1. Supports ThreadError. Registry data can be of any type.
member.param: Receives data. For example a struct variable (unsafe address).
Max data size to get. For example, Marshal.SizeOf(variable) or Marshal.SizeOf(typeof(DATA)).
Registry value name.
Registry key.
If not null, the 'key' argument is a subkey of this key or hive; if the 'key' argument is null or "", parentKeyOrHive is the direct parent key of the value.
member.exception: When key starts with "HKEY_" but it is an invalid hive name.

member.summary: Memory that can be used by multiple processes and app domains. Faster and more raw/unsafe than System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.SharedMemory.CreateOrGet(System.String,System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates named shared memory of specified size. If already exists, just gets its address. Returns shared memory address in this process. Calls Api.CreateFileMapping() and Api.MapViewOfFile().
member.param: Shared memory name. Case-insensitive.
Shared memory size. The function uses it only when creating the memory; it does not check whether the size argument matches the size of existing memory.
Allow UAC low-integrity-level processes to access the shared memory.
member.exception: When fails.
member.remarks: Once the memory is created, it is alive at least until this process ends. Other processes can keep the memory alive even after that. There is no Close function to close the native shared memory object handle. The OS closes it when this process ends.

member.summary: Gets pointer to the shared memory.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.LibProcessMemory
member.summary: Memory shared by all appdomains of current process. Size 0x10000 (64 KB). Initially zero.
member.remarks: When need to prevent simultaneous access of the memory by multiple threads, use lock("uniqueString"){...}. It locks in all appdomains, because literal strings are interned, ie shared by all appdomains. Using some other object with 'lock' would lock only in that appdomain. However use this only in single module, because ngened modules have own interned strings.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.WorkCallbackData
member.summary: Work callback function parameter type. More info: .

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.WorkCallback
member.summary: Work callback function type.
member.param: Contains state and completionCallback that were passed to the submit function. Your work callback function can change completionCallback and/or state. For example it can set completionCallback = null to prevent calling it (the call is expensive); or change state, if want to pass another object to the completion function. Note that the completion function is never called if initially it was null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.SubmitCallback(System.Object,Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.WorkCallback,System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback)
member.summary: Requests that a thread pool thread call the callback function.
member.param: Something to pass to the callback functions.
Callback function to call in a thread pool thread.
Optional callback function to call in this thread after workCallback.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.CreateWork(System.Object,Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.WorkCallback,System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback)
member.summary: Creates a Work object that can be used when need more options than SubmitCallback() has.
member.param: Something to pass to the callback functions.
Callback function to call in a thread pool thread.
Optional callback function to call in this thread after workCallback.
member.remarks: Call Dispose() to avoid memory leaks. If not called, the object and related OS object remain in memory until this appdomain ends.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work
member.summary: Allows to submit a callback function (one or more times) to be called in thread pool threads, then optionally wait and cancel. Can be used when need more options than SubmitCallback() has.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work.Submit
member.summary: Requests that a thread pool thread call the callback function. This function can be called multiple times.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work.Wait
member.summary: Waits until all submitted instances of the callback function finish their work. While waiting, this thread cannot dispatch events and Windows messages.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work.Cancel
member.summary: Waits until all running instances of the callback function finish their work, and cancels pending (still not running) instances. While waiting, this thread cannot dispatch events and Windows messages.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work.Dispose
member.summary: Calls Cancel(), releases all resources used by this object and allows this object to be garbage-collected. Call this to avoid memory leaks. If not called, the object and related OS object remain in memory until this appdomain ends.

member.summary: A workaround for: When showing a ContextMenuStrip menu or a submenu, something briefly sets the AppStarting cursor. Only if this process does/did not have active windows. Only if current cursor is arrow. Works well if eg I or hand. Starts before first WM_NCPAINT (after WM_SHOWWINDOW+WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING) and stops before WM_PAINT. Call this before showing a menu. Possibly also will need for some other windows.

member.summary: Gets the number of microseconds elapsed since Windows startup.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Time.Milliseconds
member.summary: Gets the number of milliseconds elapsed since Windows startup. Unlike Environment.TickCount, this function returns a 64-bit value. Calls Windows API GetTickCount64, not GetTickCount. The resolution is 10 to 16 milliseconds; use Microseconds if need better resolution.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Time.Wait(System.Double)
member.summary: Waits the specified number of seconds. Calls .
member.param: The wait time, seconds. Precision - 0.002 s (2 ms).

member.summary: Waits the specified number of milliseconds. Calls .
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait. Precision - 2 ms.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Time.DoEvents
member.summary: Retrieves and dispatches messages from the message queue of current thread. Similar to Application.DoEvents, but more lightweight. Just calls Api.PeekMessage, Api.TranslateMessage and Api.DispatchMessage. Returns false if received WM_QUIT message (reposts it), else returns true.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Time.SetTimer(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Action{Catkeys.Time.Timer_},System.Object)
member.summary: Sets new timer for this thread. Returns new Timer_ object that can be used to change or stop the timer if you want to do it not in the callback function; usually don't need it.
member.param: Time interval (period) of calling the callback function, milliseconds. Min interval is 10; if this parameter is 0-9, uses 10. Max interval is int.MaxValue.
Call the callback function once, not repeatedly. The timer will be stopped before calling the callback function.
A callback function (delegate), for example lambda.
Any object or value to pass to the callback function as Timer_.Tag.
member.remarks: Uses class Time.Timer_, which calls Api.SetTimer(). Similar to System.Windows.Forms.Timer, but has less overhead, for example does not create a hidden window. The callback function will be called in this thread. This thread must have a message loop, eg call Application.Run() or Form.ShowModal(). The timer interval precision is 10 ms. For example, if you specify intervalMS=15, actual interval time will be between 10 and 20 ms, not exactly 15. Some intervals may be longer, because the callback function is not called while this thread is processing something or waiting and not retrieving Windows messages from the thread's message queue.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Time.Timer_
member.summary: Manages a timer for this thread. Uses Api.SetTimer() and Api.KillTimer(). Similar to System.Windows.Forms.Timer, but has less overhead, for example does not create a hidden window. Used by Time.SetTimer(), more info there.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Time.Timer_.Tag
member.summary: The tag parameter of Start() or Time.SetTimer(). The 'set' function can change it.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Time.Timer_.#ctor(System.Action{Catkeys.Time.Timer_},System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance. Used by .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Time.Timer_.Start(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts timer. If already started, resets and changes its period.
member.param: Time interval (period) of calling the callback function, milliseconds.
Call the callback function once, not repeatedly. The timer will be stopped before calling the callback function.
member.remarks: If already started, this function must be called in same thread.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Time.Timer_.Stop
member.summary: Stops the timer.
member.remarks: Your callback function will never be called after this, even if a timer period is elapsed. Later you can call Start() again. Calling Stop() is optional. Must be called in same thread.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Path_
member.summary: Extends the .NET class Path.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.ExpandEnvVar(System.String)
member.summary: If path starts with '%' character, expands environment variables enclosed in %, else just returns path.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.IsFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if path matches one of these wildcard patterns: @"\\*" - network path. @"[A-Z]:\*" - local path. @"[A-Z]:" - drive name. @"%*%*" - environment variable (usually contains a full path). @"<*>*" - special string that can be used with some functions of this library. @":*" - eg shell object CLSID like "::{CLSID}" Also returns true if path looks like a URL (any protocol), eg "http://abc" or "http:" or "shell:abc". Note: don't use "filename:stream" unless it is full path.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.MakeFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Makes fully-qualified path. If path is not full path, returns Folders.ThisApp+path. Expands environment variables, processes @"..\" etc (calls Combine()).
member.param: Full path or filename or relative path.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.Combine(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Combines two paths and makes fully-qualified path. Similar to Path.Combine(), but not the same.
member.remarks: Returns fully-qualified path, with processed @"..\" etc, not relative, not short (DOS), with replaced environment variables if starts with "%". If the return value would not be full path, prepends Folders.ThisApp. If s1 and s2 are null or "", returns "". No exceptions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.IsURL(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if path is or begins with an internet protocol, eg "http://www.x.com" or "http:". The protocol can be unknown, the function just checks string format.
member.param: A file path or URL or any other string.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.CorrectFileName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces characters that cannot be used in file names. Also corrects other forms of invalid or problematic filename (except invalid length): trims spaces and other blank characters; replaces "." at the end; prepends "@" if a reserved name like "CON" or "CON.txt". Returns valid filename. Returns null if name is null. Returns "" if name is "" or contains just blank characters. Does not check name length; no correction or exception if it is 0 (or null) or greater than max filename length which is less than max path length 259.
member.param: Initial filename.
A string that will replace each invalid character. Default "-".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.Internal.IsExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if path is like ".ext" and the ext part does not contain characters ".\\/:".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.Internal.IsProtocol(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if path is like "protocol:" and not like "c:".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.SearchPath(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Finds file or directory and returns full and fully-qualified path. Returns null if cannot be found. If the path argument is not full path, searches in these places: 1. defDirs, if used. 2. . 3. Calls Api.SearchPath(), which searches in process directory, Windows system directories, current directory, PATH environment variable. 4. If .exe, tries to get path from registry "App Paths" keys.
member.param: Full or relative path or just filename with extension. Supports network paths.
0 or more directories where to search.

member.summary: Converts PIDL to file path or URL or shell object parsing name. Returns null if pidl is Zero or failed.
member.param: A value from the enumeration that specifies the type of string to retrieve. With the default value returns string that can be passed to PidlFromString. It can be a path, URL, "::{CLSID}", etc. Other often used values: Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_FILESYSPATH - returns null if pidl is not of a file system object. Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_URL - returns null if pidl is not of a URL or path. If path, returns its URL form, like "file:///C:/a/b.txt". Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_NORMALDISPLAY - returns string that is best to display in UI but cannot be passed to PidlFromString.

member.summary: Gets file icon. Extracts icon directly from the file, or gets shell icon, depending on file type, icon index, flags etc. Calls and converts to Image. Returns null if failed, for example if the file does not exist. Later call Dispose().
member.param: Any file, folder, URL like "http://..." or "shell:..." etc, shell item like "::{CLSID}" or "::{CLSID1}\::{CLSID2}". Also can be a file type like ".txt" or a protocol like "http:". If it is a file containing multiple icons (eg exe, dll), can be specified icon index like "path,index" or native icon resource id like "path,-id". If not full path, the file must be in program's folder.
Icon width and height. Also can be enum , cast to int.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons
member.summary: Gets file icons asynchronously. Use to avoid waiting until all icons are extracted before displaying them in a UI (menu etc). Instead you show the UI without icons, and then asynchronously receive icons when they are extracted. At first call Add() for each file. Then call GetAllAsync(). Create a callback function of type AsyncCallback and pass its delegate to GetAllAsync().

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a file path to an internal collection.
member.param: File path etc to pass to .
Something to pass to your callback function together with icon handle for this file.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Add(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIn})
member.summary: Adds multiple file paths to an internal collection. The same as calling Add(string, object) multiple times. This function copies the list.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items added with Add(). GetAllAsync() sets it = 0.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.GetAllAsync(Catkeys.Icons.AsyncCallback,System.Int32,Catkeys.Icons.IconFlags,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts getting icons of files added with Add(). After this function returns, icons are asynchronously extracted with , and callback called with icon handle (or Zero if failed). The callback is called in this thread. This thread must have a message loop (eg Application.Run()). If you'll need more icons, you can call Add() and GetAllAsync() again with the same _AsyncIcons instance, even if getting old icons if still not finished.
member.param: A callback function delegate.
Icon width and height. Also can be enum , cast to int.
Something to pass to callback functions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Clear
member.summary: Clears the internal collection of file paths added with Add().

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Cancel
member.summary: Stops getting icons and calling callback functions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Dispose
member.summary: Calls Cancel().

member.summary: Creates new object with all the same option values. Code var o2=o1.Copy(); does the same as var o2=new ScriptOptions(o1);.

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.Default
member.summary:
Default options used by: All threads of current script's appdomain; New ScriptOptions objects created like var o=new ScriptOptions();. Initially default speed is 100, other options false/0/null. You can modify them in scripts and script templates. Do it in ScriptClass static constructor.
static ScriptClass() { ScriptOptions.Default.speed=50; } //constructor ... Print(Option.speed); //speed of this thread Option.speed=10; //changes only for this thread
